title: 1998–99 Rangers F.C. season
text:
The 1998–99 season was the 119th season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> by <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers</a>.
Overview.
Rangers played a total of 55 competitive matches during the 1998–99 season. They started the season under new management with <a href="Dick%20Advocaat">Dick Advocaat</a> replacing <a href="Walter%20Smith">Walter Smith</a>. The squad Smith had left behind was past its best so Advocaat, with the financial backing of Murray, set about rebuilding almost the entire squad.
Success quickly followed and Advocaat built a team that gave the club their first domestic treble since the <a href="1992%E2%80%9393%20Rangers%20F.C.%20season">1992–93 season</a>. The <a href="Scottish%20Cup">Scottish Cup</a> was secured by a 1–0 win against <a href="Celtic%20F.C.">Celtic</a> and the <a href="Scottish%20League%20Cup">League Cup</a> by a 2–1 defeat of <a href="St%20Johnstone%20F.C.">St Johnstone</a>.
The club enjoyed its best season in Europe since 1992–93 as well, reaching the third round of the <a href="UEFA%20Cup">UEFA Cup</a> before being knocked out by <a href="Italy">Italian</a> side <a href="AC%20Parma">Parma</a>.

Results.
All results are written with Rangers' score first.
